newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-TIGERS ACTIVATE NEVIN, SHIP OUT COLEMAN.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-TIGERS ACTIVATE NEVIN, SHIP OUT COLEMAN.

text.p: The Detroit Tigers activated infielder/outfielder Phil Nevin from the 15-day disabled list on Wednesday and designated outfielder Vince Coleman for assignment.
Nevin has been disabled since March 21 with a sprained left wrist and recently completed a rehab assignment at Class A Lakeland (.556 average in three games) and Triple-A Toledo (.156 in five games).
The 26-year-old Nevin has 10 homers and 31 RBI in 67 total games with Detroit from 1995-96 after originally coming up with the Houston Astros for 18 gaems in the beginning of the 1995 campaign.

Coleman, who was invited to spring training as a non-roster player, has hit .071 with no homers or RBI in six games this season. The ageing basestealer, a two-time All Star, was with the sixth team in his 13-year career.
